text:
Hey, you can fetch the pipelines for an objectType with
GET*`/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}`*

`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/pipelines>`
Hey! Does using pagination give us count of being requested records? If not, how to get that count?

Thanks for your  <@U04UF7BNBK4> replay. But my side one more question,  On below API I can't fetch the label of the pipeline? without calling another API? <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/search>
One more question. To which endpoint to send test request to see if access token is valid?

no, that api will only return the internal value.

i would suggest that you make one call to the api i posted and than you keep the mapping between internal dealstage value and the actual label.
All right. Thank you :)

Hey all - does anyone know if it's possible to find out if a sales/sequence email has been opened via the API? Send status value can only be one of BOUNCED, FAILED, SCHEDULED, SENDING, or SENT but I'm surprised if there's no other way of determining if an email as been opened or not
<@U04UF7BNBK4> Thanks for your quick response
Hey there - I would be cautious with sharing your privateApp key as this potentially allows anyone in this slack to fetch data from your portal.
thanks for the comment
thanks a lot, I will try!

Regarding test environments - our prod env has custom things and more prod like data. This can be refreshed into the sandbox. The sandbox doesn't support webhooks. Has anyone been able to create a test env that can closely mimic prod but also provide webhook functionality?

Hi Guys morning
Someone can help me to translate this operators?
to what?
To make the request like, what this operators will be Contains?
So you want to know how to use the CONTAINS_TOKEN in a request?
Yep
This would pull all contacts that have a gmail email address
Are you trying to pull this information for a particular contact or just the open rates in general?

Okay, and another question
When i use the request search al the params in conditions need  to be “true”
But it’s possible to request in search some conditions using OR?
Like
FIlters X or Y or Z if one of there filters match the request will return the contacts
You should be able to install an app the uses webhooks on a sandbox account just the same way as install on the prod account. Is this not the case?
Well that'd be good, but I don't see a way to get to the App link where the webhook settings are made. All the chatting ive done with support indicates this isn't possible...
Yeah so above is the syntax for that basically if they have a gmail domain or their name is Carter or they have more than 10 deals associated to them

I mean I definitely think it's possible I've done it before. Did you develop the app that handles the webhooks yourself? if so you can just go into the app settings => Auth and then click copy install url. Then just paste that into your browser and choose the sandbox account

I'm in the process of developing the app now, yes. So when you hit the auth url, it presents you with the account to associate with, you select the sandbox and that'll enable changes in the sandbox to utlize the webhooks defined in hte developer account's app settings?
correct
you'll have to request on access token though to get the app to be fully installed on the account
ok, I'm going to try that, thanks!
of course, let me know how it goes
and just an FYI HubSpot support is great for more advanced things most of the time they just haven't worked with it enough to know how things work.
yeah, that's what I'm discovering :smile:
Again they are awesome but most customers don't ask them about these things so they just don't have enough experience
understandable
which object type are you trying to use this for? it's a little different between them

Hi <@U01QVR44MEY> and <@U04B32JHTUZ>! First of all, thanks a lot for your help, really appreciate. I'm TravelgateX Product Manager, so let me maybe give you some user context and more information about the problem we are (desperately :sweat_smile:) trying to solve here :
• We have integrated HS API into our Website and right now, the conversations thread is displayed in one single "box" with lots of emails one after each other. This is obviously a very bad UX, and on top of that, this generates lots of difficulties in terms of tickets management for our Customer Care team. I'm adding a screenshot below this message with an example of how our thread is currently being displayed in our Website integrated with HS.
• So, the problem-to-be-solved is basically to have this thread, linked to a specific ticket, look like a "state-of-the-art" thread, with comments one after another, even when the comment has been sent by email to our Customer Care and is retrieved through HubSpot. Actually, what we're looking for is exactly what we see when dealing with tickets with HS support, I'm also attaching an example of what we're looking for to be able to expose in our website, in the second screenshot below.
Thanks for answering to my question <@U01QVR44MEY>! Look, I must retrieve deals paginated.
of course, so you just want the number of deals in your HubSpot account or you want all deals?
or the count of record in one particular request?

I need
a) the count of deals in my hs account
b) the deals with given limit
And also this kinda question. How to make each next request to get the deals on that next pages?
I would really appreciate if we could have your help on this as we're struggling to understand what we need to do
Well on the first request HubSpot will give you an `after`  parameter if more deals exist. you then use the parameter in the url of the next request
b) To get a certain amount of deals you can use the list endpoint (GET*`/crm/v3/objects/deals`*)  and the limit parameter. If you set the limit to 10 it will pull the 10 most recent records
Hi <@U01QVR44MEY> - individual contacts. The aim is to update a field that can be used for lead scoring, ie 'contact has opened an email with a particular subject'
But look I just want to get the total count of all deals, cause I surely know how many I got because I set myself the limit parameter.

As you said <@U04B32JHTUZ>, maybe it would even be better to have a meeting with you, our engineers involved in this topic, and whoever could help on a technical side? Do you think we could have this chat Monday, Tuesday or Wednesday next week? Thanks a ton for your help!
Honestly you might want to look into HubSpot's score property. I think this is a perfect use case for it <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/set-up-score-properties-to-qualify-leads>
Yes I'm using this but I can't find an out of the box way of adding a score if a contact has opened a particular non-marketing email
Let’s assume if there are 8123 deals already created, if I’d send a plain request to get all deals and the have the length of that deals array, it will kill my frontend for like 1 minute
It worked! Thanks!
Well HubSpot limits you to 500 deals a call max, so I don't think that's a problem
you would be able to display data as it's coming in
of course bro

Okay let’s assume we have overcome that part, but what about when data is slightly less, like 87, and want to draw a table in frontend which must show the total count of records. I concern only about that part
Would it not work just to sort the emails (messages) by create date?
For that type of thing you'll probably want to use the search api because it will return the total number of records: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
I think you greatly helped me! Thanks very very much!!
of course
If possible, just one more question
go for it

Via Owners API I get my hs app’s all users. Now must search in deals and filter out only those which owner is specific user by id. Couldn’t find the proper solution or documentation for how could that be done.
I have tried in this way that doesn’t work
Well I just tried this my self and it worked like a charm
do you want to share your request?
Of course just a minute!
<@U01QVR44MEY> ’`{"filterGroups":[{"propertyName":"HubSpot_owner_id","operator":"EQ","value":"368502631"}],"`
here is the body
yeah that's definitely not going to work
not formatted correctly
ah i missed filters :smile:
:arrow_up: use this
Thanks a lot <@U01QVR44MEY>! May I ask one more question?
Does anybody know is the Page API would actually let you copy full page content from one HubSpot CMS instance to another?
There's still no good way to do development on the CMS in a completely separate instance because of the inability to move content
of course
I think you fully helped me to do my tasks :smile: look must search in existing deals by dealname. how that can be done?

I think `{`
            `propertyName: 'dealname',`
            `operator: 'CONTAINS_TOKEN',`
            `value: `${query}`,`
          `}`
this config should work
but as i see it is case sensitive
how do you want the search to happen? do you want `car` to pull back `carter` or just `car`?
first version, SQL Like search
use this :arrow_up:
Thanks A lot <@U01QVR44MEY>, that really worked for me greatly!! One more time, thanks!!
of course, glad I could help

Taking a step back, are you aware you have access to HubSpot's own <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/inbox/set-up-a-customer-portal|customer portal> functionality and/or is there a set of reasons which you are choosing to build your own from scratch?
Most people need to build out their own portals because HubSpot's is very limited in what it can handle and the data you can present. (I've been in this camp for 2 years now)

Hi <@U04B32JHTUZ> and <@U01QVR44MEY>! Thanks for your answers, and indeed, the answer is exactly the one Carter is writing, we are not using this portal as we are seeing some limitations with it. Regarding your other answer <@U01QVR44MEY>:
> Would it not work just to sort the emails (messages) by create date?
I prefer to let <@U0513B5HKEU> answer you
I think then Carter's got the right sense, which is that
darn pressed send to early

1. there is probably a way to help you get what you want around retrieving and sorting individual messages associated with a thread
2. there are only workarounds to initiating new threads (I've learned Carter is an expert in these), that's part of our vision with this API but no hard timelines yet. and that's where I'd want to interview you (more discovery interview than 'help you solve your current problem') about the kinds of things you wish your own customer portal could do, especially as it relates to two-way communication

Granted you can pretty easily build out your own portal on HubSpot and use graphql for data and use serverless functions and membership pages for all the auth and updating/creating tickets and conversations

apologies if this is the wrong place the be asking this, but is it possible to use the CRM API to create a contact and include subscriptions in the request body? Or do we need to call `/communication-preferences/v3/subscribe`  as a secondary call after creating the contact?
you unfortunately have to call the preferences endpoint to subscribe them
You can create them as a marketing contact right out of the gate though (using workflows)

I was trying to figure out what the batch limit is for the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals#|batch update deals> api endpoint?

POST*`/crm/v3/objects/deals/batch/update`*

It wasn't very clear from <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details#rate-limits|the documentation> how many records you could include in a batch, just how many calls you could make in 10 seconds. Does anyone know what the batch limit is?
it's 100

Hello Guys,

I have created an Custom app using developer account, and successful installed the app in HubSpot account(app is visible in connected apps after install)

But getting error on calling api (crm/v3/extensions/calling/24392836/settings)-
`{`
    `"status": "error",`
    `"message": "This app (ID: 24392836) doesn't match the account '23433315'. Make sure both IDs are correct or that the app is associated with the correct account.",`
    `"correlationId": "5392f6e0-379a-4e8f-a73f-0a31f0740c58",`
    `"context": {`
        `"appId": [`
            `"24392836"`
        `],`
        `"portalId": [`
            `"23433315"`
        `]`
    `},`
    `"category": "VALIDATION_ERROR",`
    `"subCategory": "OwnedApplicationError.APPLICATION_NOT_FOUND"`
`}`

Any thoughts ?
Are you using the developer hapikey?
yes using hapikey

What is the channel for App development related questions? 

I want to add field mapping options in one of the HubSpot App settings but I am not sure what is the correct method to add those mapping and how I will be able to use those fields mapping in my app to synchronise the data from one app to another app
<@U01QVR44MEY> <@U25PYL3Q8>
from the developer app account? and did that account build the app?
This is a good place
Yes using the hapikey from developer account which created the app

<@U01QVR44MEY> I am actually trying to call
GET*`/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings`*
(<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/calling-sdk>)

What should be the appId here ?
The app id of the app you built and install on the account.
you can find the id in the auth section of the app settings:

Hi, Use below filter
``` "propertyName": "dealstage",
          "operator": "EQ",
          "value": "closed"```
